meanings.definition: A male bird, especially a rooster.
meanings.sent1: The farm had many cocks crowing at dawn.
meanings.sent2: The colorful cock strutted proudly in the yard.
meanings.sent3: The cock woke up the whole neighborhood with its loud crowing.
meanings.sent4: The cock's vibrant feathers shimmered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: The cock's crow echoed through the valley, signaling the start of a new day.

meanings.definition: A faucet or valve for controlling the flow of liquid.
meanings.sent1: Mom turned the cocks to stop the water from dripping.
meanings.sent2: The plumber fixed the leaky cock in the kitchen sink.
meanings.sent3: The cock in the bathroom made funny noises when you turned it.
meanings.sent4: The old cock in the garden was rusty and hard to turn.
meanings.sent5: The shiny new cock in the shower made water flow smoothly.

meanings.definition: To tilt or turn something to one side.
meanings.sent1: She carefully cocks her head to listen better.
meanings.sent2: The cat cocks its ears when it hears a noise.
meanings.sent3: He cocks the steering wheel to avoid the pothole.
meanings.sent4: The detective cocks an eyebrow in surprise.
meanings.sent5: The cowboy cocks his hat to shield his eyes from the sun.
